Name: Rebekah's Apple Cinnamon Muffins
Ingredients: Optional: 1/2 cup raisins; 1/2 cup chopped walnuts
Directions: Preheat oven to 400F. Grease muffin tin.
In a large bowl, beat oil and sugar together. Add eggs and vanilla and mix more.
In a separate bowl, mix together the flour, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt
Add the dry ingredients to the oil mixture and stir until just combined. It may be very thick, almost like cookie dough
Add in the apples and anything else. If it's still really crumbly, add a little bit of water, but it should still be pretty thick. You'll be able to shape it with your hands.
Bake 20-25 minutes. These muffins freeze well.

Name: Da's Coffee Cake
Ingredients: Equivalent of 1 egg (1 T flaxmeal plus 2.5 T water)
1/4 cup butter (not margarine. Must be cold, not melted, and solid)
Directions: Preheat oven to 375F.
Sift together the flour, salt, and baking powder
Cream the butter and sugar together in a separate bowl until fluffy
Add the egg replacement and milk to the sugar and butter
Add all of it together, and also the vanilla
Stir until smooth. Spread into a greased pan
Streusel:
Combine all ingredients together to form a crumble
Spread the streusel over the batter. Bake for 25 minutes uncovered.

Name: Ma's Cranberry-Orange Muffins
Ingredients: 3/4 cup orange juice (about one large orange)
1 flaxegg (1 T flaxmeal + 2.5 T water, let sit 5 min)
2 cups coarsely chopped fresh cranberries (about 8 oz)
Directions: Combine flour, 1 cup sugar minus 1 T, baking powder, salt, and baking soda in a large bowl
Make well in center of mixture
Combine rind, juice, oil, and flaxegg in a small bowl, stirring well with a whisk. Add to flour mixture
Fold in cranberries and walnuts. Spoon batter into 16 muffin cups coated with cooking spray.
Sprinkle evenly with reserved sugar (1 T)
Bake at 400F for 15 minutes or until the muffins spring back when touched lightly in center.

Name: Cranberry Nut Bread
Ingredients: 2 T ground flax plus 6 T water to replace 2 eggs (or other egg replacer)
1/2 cup veganaise (I've used mock sour cream in a pinch)

Name: Fluffy Pancakes
Directions: Mix together the flour, baking powder and salt.
Mix together the milk, oil, maple syrup and vanilla extract in a separate bowl
Pour the liquid mixture into the dry mixture. Stir until combined, so only a few lumps remain (don't over-mix or your pancakes will be tough!)

Name: Granola
Directions: Mix all ingredients
Bake at 325 on two baking sheets lined with parchment. Bake for 20 minutes, stir, then bake for about 15 minutes more.
Can add chia, flax, or hemp seeds after done cooking.

Name: Chartwell's Tofu Scramble
Ingredients: 3/4 cup of coarsely chopped whole peeled garlic
Directions: Drain tofu well
Add spices and nooch and stir

Name: Tofu-Spinach Scramble
Ingredients: 1 t olive oil or 1/4 cup veggie broth
Directions: Press and drain the tofu
Crumble the tofu with your hands and set aside
Saute onion, garlic, celery, and carrots until onion is softened
Add the tofu and spices and continue to cook until the tofu begins to brown
Add the spinach and mix. Cover, reduce heat, steam spinach for 3 minutes

Name: Tortilla Breakfast Casserole
Ingredients: 1 can black beans, rinsed and drained
1/2 cup shredded vegan cheddar or pepper jack cheese, divided
Directions: Preheat oven to 350F. Coat a 9x9 baking pan with cooking spray.
In a bowl, combine the tofu scramble with the beans, nooch, and hot sauce. Set aside.

In the bottom of the baking pan, place 5 corn tortillas.Spread half of the tofu and bean mixture over the tortillas. Spread 1/4 cup of cheese over the top. Layer the remaining 5 tortillas over the cheese. Spread the remainder of the tofu and bean mixture over the tortillas. Spread the remaining 1/4 cup cheese over the top.
Bake for 20 minutes.

Name: Ma's Oatmeal Scones (Recommended)
Ingredients: 2.5 sticks unsalted butter cut into bits
1 cup chopped dried cranberries or other dried fruits and/or nuts
cup buttermilk (see buttermilk recipe in Toppings, Sauces, and Sides)
Directions: Blend the flour through butter in a food processor until coarsely blended.
Pour into large bowl and add the rest of the ingredients.
Mix until just blended. Form into a long, flat log. Divide into five sections and cut each section in half diagonally.
If not ready to bake, wrap them and freeze the dough.
When ready to bake place on baking sheet with silicon mat and bake at 350F for 30-40 minutes.

Name: New Year's Cinnamon Rolls
Ingredients: 80 grams fresh yeast or 4 t active dry yeast or 4 t instant yeast
Directions: If you're using instant yeast, mix it directly with flour. For other types of yeast in a small bowl combine lukewarm milk with sugar and yeast. Let stand until yeast activates, about 10 minutes. The yeast will become foamy and start expanding.

Put the yeast mixture together with the remaining ingredients in a bowl of your food processor or mixer. Mix well until you get soft dough, similar to pizza dough. If the dough seems too dry (depending on the kind of flour you're using), add a little bit more milk or water. If it is too soft, add a little flour.
Combine dough with white sugar. Roll on a floured surface into a rectangle, leaving 1/2 inch border on the long sides.
Spread with 6 T melted butter and sprinkle with brown sugar and cinnamon. Can also add walnuts, raisins, and whatever else you like. Starting at a long edge, roll dough into log.
With seam side down, cut roll with a thin sharp knife into 15-16, 1 inch slices. Place slices in a buttered pan. Let rise in a warm place about 20-25 minutes or until almost double in size.
Bake in preheated 350F oven for about 20-30 minutes or until tops are golden.
Remove cinnamon rolls from oven and invert onto rack. Let cool a bit.
Glaze: In a small bowl, combine 3 T melted butter, cream, powdered sugar, and vanilla. Drizzle glaze over rolls.

Name: Aunt Cris' Banana Bread
Ingredients: 2 T flaxmeal + 5 T of water. Mix and let sit for a few minutes
Directions: Bake at 350. Grease loaf pan. Mix bananas and flaxmeal. Stir in flour, sugar, salt, and baking soda. Add nuts. Bake 45-1 hour.

Name: Leslie Raney's Zucchini Bread
Ingredients: 3 cups shredded zucchini (I squeeze out some of the water but not all of it)
Directions: Bake at 350 for one hour.

Name: Plain Bread
Ingredients: 1.5 cups warm water (110 degrees if possible)
Directions: In a bowl, stir the flour, salt, yeast, and water until combined.
Cover with plastic wrap and set at room temperature for 8-24 hours.
Turn dough out onto well floured surface and form a ball. Rest for 30 minutes.
In the meantime, place baking dish with high sides into the oven and preheat to 450 degrees.
Slash X on top of bread. Carefully transfer to baking dish and cover. Bake 30 minutes; uncover and bake 10-15 minutes more until golden brown. Cool before slicing.

Name: Whole Wheat Sandwich Bread
Ingredients: 2.5 cups warm water (110 degrees if possible)
2 T molasses (I found this was too much)
1 T coarse salt or 2 t table salt
Directions: In a large bowl dissolve the yeast in 1/2 cup of the warm water
Stir in the molasses, maple syrup, salt, butter or oil, the remaining water and the flour, cup by cup, until the dough becomes hard to stir.
Turn the dough out, using the same flour to dust your work surface. Let rest while you clean out and grease your bowl.
Knead the dough, adding more of the same flour as required, until it becomes smooth and loses most of its tackiness-about 8-10 minutes (or like 3, you know).
Return it to the greased bowl and cover with plastic wrap. Let rise until almost double its volume-2 hours or more.
Punch the dough down, then shape it into two loaves and place in greased bread pans (I found greased/buttered PLUS floured works best).
Cover lightly with a towel and let rise until the dough almost reaches the top of the pans, about 1 hour or so.
Bake in a preheated 350 degrees oven for 45 minutes. Remove the loaves and cool on racks. COOL COMPLETELY BEFORE SLICING.

Name: French Bread
Directions: Combine 1/4 C water, yeast and 1 tsp sugar into a bowl.
Allow to stand for 5 minutes until yeast is bubbly.
Add in 1 Tbsp sugar, salt and water.
Mix well.
Add flour.
Mix well and knead for 5 minutes or until dough is smooth.
Allow to rise until double (about 15-20 minutes)
On a lightly floured surface roll out with a rolling pin. (May divide dough into two pieces for two smaller loaves if desired)
Roll dough up jelly roll style and turn ends under and place seam down on a greased
cookie sheet. Cut 3 diagonal slits into each loaf (only about 1/4 inch deep)
Gently brush aquafaba on loaves (optional).
Preheat oven to 300 degrees.
Boil a pan of water and then put it into a shallow dish.
TURN OFF OVEN
Place pan of water on lower rack and then bread on shelf above pan of water.
Allow to rise until double (about 20 minutes)
Remove pan of water
Leave bread in the oven and turn oven to 425 degrees and bake bread for 10 minutes. (this includes the preheating time)
Reduce oven to 375  after ten minutes and continue to bake for 6-8 minutes longer or until bread is golden brown.

Name: Rosemary Bread
Directions: Stir the yeast, sugar and 1/4 cup warm water in a lar ge bowl (or in the bowl of a stand mixer). Let sit until foamy, about 5 minutes.
Add 1 tablespoon olive oil, the flour, rosemary, the fine salt and 3/4 cup warm water; stir with a wooden spoon (or with the dough hook if using a mixer) until a dough forms.
Cover with plastic wrap and let stand at room temperature until more than doubled, about 2 hours.

Brush 2 baking sheets with olive oil. Generously flour a work surface; turn the dough out onto the flour and divide into 2 pieces. Working with one piece at a time, sprinkle some flour on the dough, then fold the top and bottom portions into the middle. Fold in the sides to make a free-form square. Use a spatula to turn the dough over, then tuck the corners under to form a ball. Place seam-side down on a prepared baking sheet. Repeat with the remaining dough, putting 2 balls on each baking sheet. Let stand, uncovered, until more than doubled, about 2 hours.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Bake the loaves 10 minutes; brush with some olive oil and sprinkle with the kosher salt and some more rosemary. Continue baking until golden brown, about 20 more minutes. Transfer to a rack to cool

Name: Rye Bread (Recommended)
Directions: In a bowl, combine all the dry ingredients, mix around, and then add the wet ingredients.
Knead for a while, like 10 minutes, adding bread flour if it's sticky
Place the dough in a large bowl that's a bit wet and cover with a towel or something. Let the dough rise in a warm place until doubled in size, about 1 1/2 hours
When the dough has risen, punch it down and transfer to a clean work surface. Let it rest for 5 minutes then shape it into a loaf and transfer to a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.

Cover with a towel and let rise for another hour until doubled in size again. When the dough is close to being double in size, preheat the oven to 425F. Slash the dough with a sharp knife to create gashes on top.

Open the oven a throw a few ice cubes on the bottom when you place the bread into bake (I just put a dish with water on the rack  underneath instead). This will create the steam that will make for a great crust to the bread. Bake for 30 minutes until crusty and golden brown.

Name: Challah (Recommended)
Ingredients: 1/4 cup oil (neutral-flavored such as grapeseed or canola, plus additional for oiling the bowl)
2 teaspoons salt (kosher salt or pink Himalayan sea salt)
Directions: Place the warm water in a large bowl or stand mixer. Add a pinch of the sugar to the bowl, and sprinkle with the yeast. Set aside in a warm place for 5 to 10 minutes, until the mixture is foamy. (If your yeast doesn't proof properly, discard the mixture and start again with fresh yeast).

Mix in the sugar, oil, 2 cups of flour, and salt. Add the remaining flour 1 cup at a time, mixing well after each addition until a shaggy dough forms and begins to pull into a ball. (You might or might not need the last 1/2 cup of flour. If the dough is very wet or sticky, add it. If not, use some of it to dust your work surface). NOTE: Mira says to make it yellow, you can add a bit of turmeric (because egg usually makes challah yellow).

Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured work surface. With clean, floured hands, knead the dough until it is smooth and elastic, about 3 minutes. NOTE: Mira recommends only kneading for as long as it takes to make a ball that holds its shape. Allow the dough to rest for a few minutes while you clean and dry the large mixing bowl. Grease the inside of the bowl with a bit of oil. Place the challah dough in the bowl and turn to coat with the oil. Cover the bowl with a damp tea towel or plastic wrap and set aside in a warm place until the dough has risen to at least double its bulk, about 1 hour and 45 minutes.

Punch the dough down. Lightly grease one or two baking sheets, or line with parchment paper. Shape or braid the dough as desired. (The recipe will make 1 large challah, 2 medium challahs, 1 medium challah plus 6 challah rolls, or 12 challah rolls.)
Place the shaped challah and/or rolls on the baking sheet(s) and cover with clean, dry tea towels. Allow to rise until doubled, about 45 minutes to 1 hour.

Heat the oven to 350 F. Bake the challah until the crust is a deep golden brown, and the loaf sounds hollow when tapped, about 30 to 35 minutes for a large challah, 20 to 25 minutes for a medium challah, and 15 to 20 minutes for rolls. Cool on a wire rack.

Name: Bagels for the Commune
Ingredients: 3 1/2 cups (500g) bread flour + more for kneading OR all purpose flour (bread flour recommended but not essential)
Toppings (poppy seeds, toasted onion, vegan cheese, sesame seeds, etc)
Directions: Mix the yeast, flour, and salt in a large bowl. Add the warm water. Mix well until a smooth dough forms. If it is too dry, add a bit more water (careful - only add a little at a time). If it is too wet, add some more flour. If you want to add anything to the dough like sesame seeds, now's the time. **If you want to add cranberries, now is the time. (see variation #1 below)
Flour a countertop or large cutting board, and knead the dough for 10 minutes, or until it is smooth and elastic.

Wet the inside of a clean large non-metal bowl with water, place the dough inside, and turn to coat until the outside is moist. Cover with a damp dish towel and set it to rise in a warm place for 1 hour, or until it has doubled in size. Once risen, punch down the dough and take out of bowl.
Cover a baking sheet with silicone baking mat or parchment paper and set aside. Remove the dough from the bowl, and divide the dough into 8 pieces. Roll each piece into a ball.

Now here's what I've discovered you should do: take the balls and pinch in the sides underneath, so the top gets really round and perfect. Then place the ball on the table with the bottom side down and form a lose cup shape with your hand and then roll your hand around the ball, careful not to squish the top - this will help even out the bottom. Once you've done this, you should set it aside to rise for like 10 minutes. Then after that, use your thumb to press down in the center. Then pick it up and use your thumb and pointer finger to make a hole, and then use both your pointer fingers to stretch out the hole evenly. If you only stretch it out a little bit, you'll end up with bagels that don't have much of a hole, which is fine. The more you stretch it out, the uglier it gets, though. So I like to stretch it out enough that it has a definite hole, but not too much. The bagels will expand when you boil them.

Once the water has boiled, reduce the heat to medium, and use a slotted spoon to lower as many bagels that fit comfortably into the water (I do four and use two pots so I have eight going at once). Once they float to the top (a couple seconds), boil for 2 minutes, flip, then boil for another 2 minutes. For less chewiness, boil for less time. I tend not to time it and it always works out.

Once all the bagels have boiled, transfer them to your lined baking sheet. Brush the dough with milk, and sprinkle with your seasoning. I worry about my bagels being too wet, so I usually transfer them to a baking sheet lined with a towel first, let them dry for a sec, then use my hands to rub milk on the tops (I don't have a brush), and then I transfer them to a baking sheet with the silicon mat and put the toppings on. The faster you put the toppings on, the better, because more will stick. Actually, scratch that - put the toppings on first, and then the milk. The stickiness of the bagels right after they've been boiled is ideal for getting the toppings to stick. And the way we've discovered to do this is to get a bowl that's not much bigger than the bagel and fill it with some seasoning, and then place the bagel upside down in it (it'll be hot, be careful) and swirl it around a bit so the seasoning coats the top and the sides.
Bake the bagels 20 minutes, or until golden brown. (I consistently do 22 minutes). Remove from oven and cool on a wire rack.
Wait until they are COMPLETELY cooled to put them in a container or bag. I would also wait until they are cool to cut them, if you're going to pre-cut them.
If you aren't going to eat them all in the next few days (or next one day, if you live somewhere humid), then freeze them. There are no preservatives, they won't stay good long.
Note: Most bagel recipes call for the bagels to be boiled with honey. I tried it with dandelion honey (recipe on this doc) and I couldn't tell much of a difference.

Variation #1 from Jen: add 1 cup coarsely chopped fresh cranberries and a teaspoon of lemon zest right after the mixture has incorporated the water. You will have to decrease the water by some amount, maybe half a cup, maybe more, because of the wetness of the cranberries.

Variation #2 from Sarah: add like 5 fresh chopped jalapenos into dough like 8 minutes into kneading. I added seeds and all but next time I might take seeds out cause they were weird to encounter in the cooked bagels. Topped with cheese before cooking. Very, very good.

Name: Flatbread Stuffed with Fried Onion, Oregano, and Sumac
Ingredients: 1 cup oregano leaves; reserve 1 spoonful for garnish
Directions: Dough

Combine all the ingredients in a large bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a bread hook. Mix on low speed until the ingredients are combined and a ball starts to form. Then increase the speed to medium and mix until the dough is smooth and elastic, 10-15 minutes. Cover the dough with a damp towel and let rise in a warm, draft-free area until doubled in volume, about 1 hour.
Punch dough down and divide it into 5 balls. Arrange balls on a baking sheet, cover with a towel, and let rise for 30 minutes
Filling

Heat 1/4 cup olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and saute until soft and golden, about 15 minutes. Stir in the oregano and sumac. Remove from heat and cool completely. Season with salt.
Assembly

Place a ball of dough on a lightly floured surface. Using the heel of one hand, flatten and stretch dough into a rectangle. Lightly dust a rolling pin with flour and roll dough out into a 3x8 rectangle. Spread a fifth of the filling onto the rectangle, then fold into an envelope. Roll dough into 3x8 rectangle with a 1/4 inch thickness. Cute ach rectangle in half then in half again to form 4 triangles. Repeat with remaining dough balls and filling.
To fry

Heat the 3 cups olive oil to 375F in a large heavy pot. Add triangles of dough (in batches, do not crowd) and fry until puffed and golden brown, about 3 minutes per side. Remove from oil using a slotted utensil and drain on towels. Serve immediately.

Name: Hamburger Buns
Ingredients: 1/2 cup non-dairy milk (I used homemade almond milk)
1 flax egg (1 tbs ground flax seeds + 3 tbs water)
1 tablespoon organic coconut oil or vegan butter (melted - to brush over the tops)
Directions: In the bowl of a standing mixer, stir the yeast into the warm water and let it sit until dissolved.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the non-dairy milk, flax egg, coconut oil, sugar and pink himalayan salt.
Add this to the yeast mixture and stir until well combined.
Add all the flour mixture and stir until it forms a shaggy dough.
Knead at low speed for 10 minutes (The finished dough should be smooth, feel slightly tacky and spring back when poked).
Cover and let the dough rise in a warm spot until doubled in size (approximately one hour).
Dust your work area with a little flour and turn out the risen dough on top.
Divide the dough into 8 pieces and shape each piece into a tight ball.
Transfer the balls onto a baking sheet and let them rise until they look puffy and hamburger-sized (approximately 30 - 40 minutes).
Melt the butter and brush it over the risen hamburger buns (This helps the tops to brown and keeps the crust soft).
Bake the buns at 375 degrees for approximately 15 - 18 minutes (or until golden on the tops).
Let the buns cool at room temperature before slicing and using.

Name: Flour Tortillas & Tortilla Chips
Ingredients: cup extra virgin olive oil, vegetable oil or other fairly neutral flavored oil
Directions: Combine flour, salt and baking powder in the bowl of a stand mixer. Using a dough hook, mix dry ingredients until well combined.

Add oil and water with mixer running at a medium speed. After about 1 minute, or when mixture comes together and begins to form a ball, decrease mixing speed to low. Continue to mix for 1 minute or until dough is smooth. Or just mix it by hand and then knead it for a few minutes.

Transfer dough to a lightly floured work surface. Divide into 16 equal portions. Turn each piece to coat with flour. Form each piece into a ball and flatten with the palm of your hand. Cover flattened balls of dough with a clean kitchen towel and allow to rest for at least 15 minutes (or as much as 2 hours) before proceeding.

After the rest period, heat a large pan over medium heat. Roll each dough piece into a rough circle, about 6-7 inches in diameter, keep work surface and rolling pin lightly floured. Don't stack uncooked tortillas on top of each other or they will stick together.

When the pan is hot, place one dough circle into the pan and allow to cook for about 1 minute or until the bottom surface has a few pale brown spots and the uncooked surface is bubbly. If browning too fast, reduce the heat a bit. If it's taking longer than a minute to see a few pale golden brown spots on the underside of tortillas, increase the heat a bit. Flip to the other side and cook for 15-20 seconds. The tortillas should be nice and soft but have a few small brown spots on the surface.
Remove from pan with tongs and stack in a covered container or zippered bag to keep the tortillas soft.

Serve warm or allow to cool for later use. When ready to use, place a slightly damp paper towel in the bottom of a microwave-safe container (with a cover) that will hold the stacked tortillas. Microwave uncovered for 15-30 seconds (start with 15) or until warm, then keep covered to hold heat while serving.

Store in an airtight container or zippered bag at room temperature for 24 hours or refrigerate for up to 1 week. To freeze, separate tortillas with parchment paper or waxed paper and place in a zippered bag before placing in the freezer.
For chips, cut the cooked tortillas into smaller triangles, add a bit of olive oil and salt and whatever else you want, and bake them for a while in the oven at 350F.

Name: FUUL Bowl (Mo's adaptation - Recommended)
Ingredients: Couscous or quinoa or grain of choice
A lemon plus 3 T lemon juice (would recommend using a fresh lemon for the kale marinade and garlic sauce and lemon juice for the tofu marinade)
Extra firm tofu, drained and pressed
Veggies of your choice, I'd recommend 1 red bell pepper, 1 yellow onion, and 6-7 brussel's sprouts
1/2 cup Vegan mayo or vegan garlic mayo
About 10 cherry tomatoes, cut in half
A few pickled jalapenos, cut into pieces
Also could be good: Toasted pecans or walnuts, hemp hearts, avo-cilantro dressing, chopped cucumber
Directions: Start your tofu marinating. Combine soy sauce and lemon juice (doesn't really matter the amount/ratio) in a pan or bag. Slice your tofu how you want, I'd recommend thin and wide slabs. Place in the marinade. Preheat the oven to 400F
Chop your veggies to saute (red pepper, brussel's sprouts, onion). Place them in a pan on medium heat.
If you're making a grain like quinoa, start that. If you're using couscous, you can wait because it doesn't take long at all.
Make your lemon garlic aioli by combining the mayo, 2 cloves garlic (skip if using garlic mayo), 2 T fresh squeezed lemon juice, 1/4 t salt and 1/4 t pepper. Let sit so the garlic infuses the mayo

De-stem your kale and place it in a bowl with the rest of the fresh squeezed lemon juice. You could also add a tiny bit of balsamic vinegar if you want. Massage it with your hands for a couple minutes.
Start your couscous if that's the grain you choose. Don't forget to keep stirring the sauteing veggies.

Place your marinated tofu on a silpat mat or parchment paper in the oven for 10 minutes. If you have a panini press or grill, take it out after 10 minutes and grill it for 5-10 minutes. If you're using a panini press, you may need to stack the tofu so that it's tall enough to press against both sides. If you don't have a press or grill, bake it for another 5-10 minutes to your liking.
Chop your tomatoes, jalapenos, avocado, and any other veggies you're using for the top. Seed your pomegranate. Pull some stems off your parsley.

Place the grain into the bowl with the massaged kale. Follow with the sauteed veggies on one side and tofu on the other. Place the fresh veggies and avocado on top, drizzle with garlic aioli (I'd use a lot) and balsamic glaze. Place the pomegranate seeds and any other topping you're using and garnish with parsley around the edges. If you're only one person, you'll have left overs, so leave half the ingredients out and store them in separate containers to make later.

Name: Zuch Pasta
Ingredients: Coconut cream, or canned coconut milk & use the top layer
Directions: Mince Garlic and add it to a pan with the olive oil, Saute until starts to brown
Add half bell pepper diced and the handful of sun dried tomatoes roughly chopped
Give it a minute then add the zucchini-quartered then cubed (?)
Cook until zucchini is almost done then turn the heat up and brown the edges
Then add in pasta sauce, however saucy you want it, and add the coconut cream-enough to make the sauce an orangish color
Cook down if it's too liquidy for your liking and then mix in pasta of choice :)

Name: The Office Wrap
Ingredients: Lemon garlic aioli or a similar aioli (check Toppings, Sauces, Sides section)
Directions: Caramelize the onions by sauteing them on low heat for 30 minutes. Optional: add in salt and some balsamic vinegar near the end
Preheat oven to 450F
Create a marinade by combining some soy sauce, lemon juice, and pepper
Drain and slice the tofu into whatever size/shape you want for your wrap. I'd recommend flat rectangles
Put them in the marinade for at least 15 minutes (the longer the better)
Bake them in the oven for 15-25 minutes, depending on preference
Massage kale for 2-3 minutes with the aioli
Spread hummus on the wrap, then the onions, tofu, and kale
Grill in a grill or on a pan
Cut in half to eat

Name: Samosa Muffins
Directions: Heat oil in a large skillet on medium-high heat. Add onion and cook until soft about 4 minutes, stir in garlic and ginger and cook for 2 minutes.
Stir in curry powder, sea salt, cayenne pepper, cilantro and cook for 2 more minutes stirring constantly
Add peas and stir to coat. Remove skillet from heat and stir in mashed potato and mix well.
Spoon potato mixture evenly in muffin pan and bake for 30 minutes or until golden brown.
Allow to slightly cool for at least 10 minutes (very important step) to make sure muffins don't fall apart. Remove from pan and enjoy!

Name: Kate's Mac n Cheese
Ingredients: Mustard (I use yellow, you can try whatever) (just keep adding it until you like how it tastes)
Non dairy cheese shreds of choice (optional but highly recommended)
Optional add-ins: Chili Powder, Chipotle Powder, Liquid Smoke, Sriracha, Turmeric, Lemon Juice, Vinegar of some sort (I usually don't include an acid at all)
*Note that if you leave out everything that is optional, you'll probably want to replace them with something else. Like garlic powder could probably be replaced with actual garlic or garlic salt.
Directions: Melt butter in a pot, add flour to make a roux
Slowly add small amounts of milk as you go
Add all spices you want, mustard, cheese, nooch, etc and mix thoroughly while heating.
Stir until combined
& then add pasta i guess Mo didnt make this part of the recipe lololol.
Probs cook your pasta at the beginning.
Taste and adjust spices if needed

Name: Mo's Thai Curry
Ingredients: Red onion (optional; I used one half)
Bell pepper (optional; I used one half)
Tofu (firm, extra firm, silken, try whatever you want to. I did extra firm and I used 1/2 a block)
Veggie broth or water (I used 2.5 cups)
Soy sauce or tamari sauce (I used about 1 Tbsp)
Lime juice (I used half a lime)
Pinch of ground cayenne pepper or red pepper flakes (could also try sriracha)
Yellow Thai curry paste or red Thai curry paste (I used yellow because it's what I had but then I added cumin as well. I used just under 1 Tbsp)
Probably could add some form of sugar (brown sugar, a liquid sugar) but I didn't
I also think crushed peanuts could be nice
Directions: Freeze the tofu the day before, and then take it out of the freezer 12 hours before you're going to use it
Cut up the tofu (I did large triangles) and bake it at 350F for about 10 minutes
In the meantime, saute all the veg a bit (not the cilantro)
Add the veg (except for the cilantro) to a pot with the coconut milk, curry paste, and broth/water
Bring to a boil and then let simmer for a bit (10 min?)
Add the tofu, tamari/soy sauce, lime juice, and cilantro (and peanuts if you want to try)
Taste it and see if you can figure out what it's missing and let me know!!

Name: Jackfruit Curry (Recommended)
Ingredients: 1/2 cup vegetable broth (add 1/2 cup more at the end depending on preference)
2 cans 20 oz. jackfruit in brine rinsed or water
1/2 red bell pepper & 1/2 green bell pepper chunked, or whatever veg you have
1/2 white onion diced 1 tbsp minced garlic
1 tbsp curry powder ( I did 2 t madras & 1 t jamacian)
1 tsp sugar (optional- I think it's fine without)

*Jackfruit- drain brine/water and quick rinse. Then you can either squish each little triangle with your hand to ring out the extra liquid, or you can smash in between a towel. I use my hands cause I hate laundry. Then go through and cut off any hard pieces and any seeds that may have snuck into the can. Honestly, I also do this part by hand because I combine it with the next step which is to pull apart the jackfruit with a fork till it's broken up sufficiently. I just rip off the hard parts & separate the pieces.
Directions: 1. In a large pan, saute onions and garlic until fragrant over medium heat with oil of your choice.
2. Add in coconut milk, vegetable broth, and seasonings. Bring to a boil, then let simmer for 10 minutes, stirring frequently.
3. Add the jackfruit and let it simmer for 5-10 minutes, the longer you leave it the more the jackfruit absorbs the flavor.
4. Add in red and green bell peppers and stir to combine. Let set for a little if you prefer your bell pepper mushy.

Name: Kerry's Potato Salad
Ingredients: Potatoes of your choosing, and any amount
Radishes (milder ones, not ones that are that spicy)
Some kind of mustard, not that much
Lots of options for other veggies and dressings, lmk what you come up with
Directions: Boil the potatoes until really soft, then mash them up. Mash them less if you want chunkier salad
Chop the veggies into whatever size you want. I do them pretty small.

Add everything together. If you're not sure how much mayo and mustard to add, start with a bit and add more as you want. I'd start with just mayo and then taste it and decide if/how much mustard you want to add.

Name: Vegan Butter Chicken
Ingredients: For the tofu (or replace with cauliflower):
2 tablespoons olive oil (I used way less)
1 tablespoon grated fresh ginger (or 1 tsp dried)
1 (13.5 oz) canned full fat coconut milk
4 cups cooked white or brown rice
Naan (look up recipe if you want)
Directions: 1. Press the tofu: Wrap the block of tofu in paper towels. Place a plate or pan on top of the wrapped tofu, and put a couple of heavy books on top of that. Let the tofu press for 20 minutes. (You can skip this step if you get the super firm variety)
2. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

3. Slice the tofu into about 6 slices (see photos in post above for reference). Now, rip each slice into medium-large pieces. You can also simply cut them into cubes, if you prefer, but ripping gives the tofu a great texture for this dish.

4. Add the tofu pieces to a large ziplock bag, along with the olive oil, cornstarch and salt. Close the bag, and shake gently to coat. Arrange the tofu evenly on the prepared pan, and bake for 25-30 minutes, until golden and crispy (I cooked it for like 40 minutes).

5. While the tofu bakes, prepare the sauce: Melt the 2 tablespoons of vegan butter in a large pan over medium-high heat. Saute the onion for 3-4 minutes in the butter, then add the ginger and garlic and cook for 1 more minute. Add the spices, salt, tomato paste and coconut milk. Stir until smooth and combined, then simmer for 5-10 minutes, stirring frequently.
6. When the tofu is done baking, add it to the sauce and stir to coat the pieces. Serve over rice with naan. Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro. Enjoy!

Name: Scott's Sweet Potato Burgers (Recommended) - Makes 6 big boys
Ingredients: (Note: I would recommend doubling if you want leftovers)
1 can/240 g chickpeas, drained and mashed (this is about 8.5 oz I think) (1/2 cup dried)
1 can/240 g mixed beans, drained and mashed (1/2 cup dried)
Handful of chopped coriander or parsley
Flesh of a sweet potato, roasted (1 big or 2 small)
3 T Piri Piri sauce (or some other spicy sauce)
Zest and juice of half a lemon
5 T flour (I often double if the batter is still wet)
Directions: Combine everything and form patties. Then bake them or just skip straight to frying them. If you're going to freeze them or put them in the fridge for another day, I'd recommend baking them and then frying them right before you eat them. If you're going to eat them right away, you can just fry them without baking them first.

Name: Barley Salad
Ingredients: 1 cup uncooked barley (or quinoa, bulgar, or grain of choice)
1 cup shredded red cabbage (or green if that's what you've got)
1 cup shredded carrots (or chopped if you can't be bothered)
1 tsp fresh minced ginger (I like to use a zester for mine)
1 T sweetener such as maple syrup
1 T red wine vinegar (rice wine works too!)
1 tsp sesame oil (pretty important not to skip this one)
Directions: Cook your grain and cool.

Put all dressing ingredients into the cup of a high speed blender or small food processor (gets lost in a big blender). Alternatively, mix all ingredients by hand very well. I often double the dressing (except the PB, which I use less of).
Mix dressing and grain. Gets better when stored in fridge, but may need a bit more dressing when serving.
Any crunchy veg will work here, be creative and clean out your produce drawer.

Name: Black Bean and Butternut Squash Burritos
Ingredients: 1 medium butternut squash, peeled, cubed, & roasted
1/2 cup uncooked short grain brown rice (yields: 1.5 cups cooked)
1 tsp kosher salt, or to taste
2 tsp ground cumin, or to taste
1/4 tsp cayenne pepper, or to taste
One 15-oz can black beans (about 1.5-2 cups cooked), drained and rinsed
Directions: Cook brown rice (for directions, see here)
In a large skillet over medium-low heat, add oil, onion, and minced garlic. Sautee for about 5 minutes, stirring frequently. Now add in salt and seasonings and stir well.

When butternut squash is tender remove from oven and cool slightly. Add 1.5 cups of the cooked butternut squash to the skillet and stir well. You can mash the squash with a fork if some pieces are too large. Add Daiya cheese and heat another couple minutes.
Add bean filling to tortilla along with desired toppings. Wrap and serve. Leftover filling can be reheated the next day for lunch in a wrap or as a salad topper

Name: Black Bean Salad with Corn, Red Peppers and Avocado in a Lime-Cilantro Vinaigrette
Ingredients: 2 15-ounce cans black beans, rinsed and drained
3 ears fresh cooked corn, kernels cut off the cob
2 tablespoons minced shallots, from one medium shallot
9 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil, best quality such as Colavita
1 teaspoon lime zest (be sure to zest limes before juicing them)
1/2 cup chopped fresh cilantro, plus more for garnish
Directions: Combine all ingredients except for avocados in a large bowl and mix well. Cover and chill for a few hours or overnight. Right before serving, add avocados and mix gently, being careful not to mash avocados. Garnish with a more chopped cilantro if desired. Serve at room temperature.

Name: Mo's Split Pea Soup
Directions: 4 cups of water for 1 cup of split peas
Saute onion and garlic in the soup pot.
Add split peas, barley, carrots, spices, and water.
Bring to boil, then reduce to simmer.
Keep mostly covered.
Add water if necessary.
Spices:
Salt
Pepper
Paprika or smoked paprika
Cayenne if spicy
Bay leaf if you're feeling fancy

Name: Norman's Burgers
Ingredients: Peperoncino (I think like cayenne? Idk we made it up while we were in Italy)
Directions: Blend chickpeas with oil and combine with veggie mush.
Add peperoncino, paprika, oregano, sage, cumin, salt, and pepper
Add flour and bread crumbs to mix and also coat patties in it.
Bake in oven 10 minutes, then flip, bake for additional 15 minutes
Fry with vegetable oil or save to fry when you want to eat them.

Name: Quinoa Stuffed Sweet Potatoes
Ingredients: 1 small green chili, deseeded and minced (for optional heat)
Directions: Rinse and dry the sweet potatoes, then slice in half lengthwise. Place cut side down on a baking sheet lined with parchment and drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with a generous amount of salt. Bake for 15 minutes, then flip and return to bake for another 10-15 minutes, or until the insides are soft and the flesh is pulling away from the skin. May take longer if you have larger sweet potatoes.
While the potatoes are baking, prep the filling.

Heat olive oil in a medium sauce pot then add the garlic, chili. Sautee for one minute then add the quinoa. Toast the quinoa for a minute or two, add the curry powder and stir to coat. Add 1 + 1/4 cups of coconut milk, 1/4 cup of water and salt. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer covered for 15 minutes. Stir in the chickpeas and remove from heat. Set aside.
Once the potatoes are done remove from the oven and set aside until cool enough to handle
Gently scoop out the soft  flesh of the sweet potatoes, trying to keep the skin intact. It's ok if you don't get it all out.
Add the potato flesh to the quinoa mixture and stir well to combined.

Spoon the quinoa mixture back into the empty potato skins until well stuffed and place back in the oven at 400 F for 10 minutes. You may have some filling left over, so you can choose to pile it high or serve on the side.
In a small blender, blend together half the avocado, 1/4 cup coconut milk, 1/2 cup cilantro, 1 tablespoon lime juice, 1/2 teaspoon lime zest and a good pinch of salt. Season to taste.
Serve potatoes with avocado cilantro sauce, fresh cilantro, sliced green onions and lime wedges. Add your favorite hot sauce and extra avocado on the side.

Name: Chickpea Mash (good, easy to simplify, easy to make, easy to eat)
Ingredients: 2 cups cooked garbanzo beans aka chickpeas, 430g
Optional: mayo, dijon mustard, fresh dill, relish
Directions: Place the garbanzo beans in a medium-sized bowl and mash them with a fork. You don't have to mash them completely. If some garbanzo beans are left whole, it's totally fine.
Add the red onion, carrot, celery, yellow mustard, lemon juice, black pepper and sea salt.
Stir until all of the ingredients are combined.

Serve on toasted sprouted grain bread or on cucumber rounds as a snack or appetizer. You can also put it in a sprouted grain tortilla or blanched collard leaf with some mixed greens and avocado to make a wrap.

Name: Pasta Salad
Ingredients: 8 ounces elbow macaroni (use whole grain or gluten-free if you'd like)
1/4 medium red bell pepper, cut into 1/4-inch dice
Salt and freshly ground pepper to taste

Name: Creamy Garlic Pasta with Roasted Tomatoes
Ingredients: 2 medium shallots or some onion, diced
1 pinch each sea salt and black pepper
2 1/2 cups unsweetened plain nut milk (sub up to 1 cup with veggie stock, if preferred)
Directions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (204 C) and toss tomatoes in a bit of olive oil and sea salt. Place cut side up on a parchment-lined baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes while you prepare the rest of the dish. Then set aside.
Bring a large pot of water to a boil and cook pasta according to package instructions. When done, drain, cover and set aside.

In the meantime, prepare the sauce. In a large skillet over medium-low heat, add 1 Tbsp olive oil and the garlic and shallot. Add a pinch of salt and black pepper and stir frequently, cooking for 3-4 minutes until softened and fragrant.

Stir in flour and mix with a whisk. Once combined, slowly whisk in the nut milk a little at a time so clumps don't form. Add another healthy pinch of salt and black pepper, bring to a simmer and continue cooking for another 4-5 minutes to thicken. Taste and adjust seasonings as needed. (Optional: You can also add a few shakes of vegan parmesan for extra flavor at this time if you wish.)

If you want an ultra creamy sauce, transfer sauce to a blender (or use an immersion blender) to blend the sauce until creamy and smooth. Place back in pan and reduce heat to a low simmer until desired thickness is reached.
Once the sauce is to your desired thickness, taste and adjust seasonings as needed. Then add pasta and roasted tomatoes and stir.
Serve immediately and garnish with extra black pepper, fresh basil, and/or vegan parmesan cheese. Best when fresh, but will keep for up to 2 days in fridge.

Name: Pumpkin-Seed/Cashew Alfredo Pasta (Recommended)
Ingredients: 1/4 cup raw pumpkin seeds or cashews
Add peas or spinach or broccoli or other veggies
Directions: Cook pasta according to instructions and keep aside.
Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add onions and garlic and cook until translucent. 3 to 4 minutes.
Add pumpkin seeds or cashews and 1/4 cup water and bring to a boil. about 4 minutes. Cook for 2 more minutes, then let it cool a bit.

Meanwhile add all the ingredients from nutritional yeast through non dairy milk to the blender (nutritional yeast, herbs, salt, lemon, vinegar, flour, pepper, olive oil, non dairy milk). Add the onion pumpkin seed mixture to the blender. Blend until smooth.

Return to the skillet over medium heat. Add another 1/4 cup water. Bring to a boil. Stir frequently to avoid lumps. The mixture will thicken considerably. Cook for another minute, so the flour is cooked through. Total 3 to 4 minutes. Carefully taste and adjust the salt and tang. Add more herbs if you wish.

Name: Cranberry Walnut Chickpea Salad Sandwich
Ingredients: 3 cups cooked or 2 cans (15 oz) garbanzo beans (chickpeas), drained and rinsed
1/2 cup organic dried cranberries (chopped fresh would be great too)
1/2 cup walnuts or pecans, roughly chopped
1/2 cup scallions (green onions), thinly sliced, white & green parts
mineral salt & freshly ground pepper, to taste (I used about 1/2 teaspoon each)
6 tablespoons (1/3 cup) tahini or vegan mayo
4 tablespoons (1/4 cup) champagne, white wine or cider vinegar (I used Orange Muscat Champagne Vinegar)
2 tablespoons water (only needed if using tahini)
Directions: Start by mixing your dressing. In a small bowl combine tahini/mayo, vinegar, water and maple syrup. Set aside so the flavors come together. This can be made a day or two ahead and stored in the refrigerator until ready to use. Add a tad more water, or vinegar if you're a vinegar lover, to thin out dressing as desired. If using vegan mayo, you may like to add 2 more tablespoons.

In a medium to large bowl, add your garbanzo beans and roughly mash with a strong fork or potato masher. Add in celery, cranberries, nuts, scallions, salt, pepper and dressing, mix well. Serve at room temp or let chill in the refrigerator for an hour before serving.
Serve on your favorite bread as a closed or open faced sandwich, or on a bed of leafy greens. You may even opt to simply enjoy the salad as is.

Name: Sarah's Bomb Ass Ravioli
Directions: You can use a bowl and finish by hand on the counter, you can use a dough hook with a mixer, or you can use a bread machine to mix. I chose the bowl and hand method.
Sift flour into a large bowl.
Make a well and add the water, oil, and salt.
Begin to mix by slowly adding the flour into the water around the well.
Once mixing becomes too hard to do in the bowl, dump the mixture onto a floured surface and knead until combined.
I like to knead it for a few minutes, lay a towel over it to let it rest, then return and repeat a few times until I have a nice smooth dough.
Wrap it in plastic wrap and let it rest on the counter for a minimum of 20-30 minutes.
While the dough is resting make the filling

Name: 10 Minute Mac-n-Cheese
Ingredients: 1 1/4 cups unsweetened almond milk (at room temperature)
Directions: Cook your pasta according to package. Drain and place back in pot, set aside.

In a small/medium saucepan, heat oil over medium heat, add flour and whisk to incorporate. Continue whisking and cook for 2 minutes. Add milk slowly, whisking constantly. Turn heat to low and cook until sauce thickens, about 8 minutes, stirring frequently. Remove from heat. Stir in nutritional yeast, salt, garlic powder, chili powder and chipotle powder. Stir until everything is incorporated and smooth again. Taste for flavor.
Add sauce to the pasta, toss well, add more milk as needed and serve right away.

Name: Shepherd's Pie
Directions: For the filling:
In a medium-large pot, over medium heat, combine oil, garlic, and onions. Cook for one minute, until onions start to soften.
Add celery and carrots, stir until onions are translucent.
Add mushrooms, corn, parsley, tomato paste, thyme, sage, salt, and pepper until well mixed.

Add veggie stock in half-cup increments, allowing it to come to a simmer before adding more. Add flour, then mix. Continue mixing until the mixture thickens. Once thick, remove from heat and pour into a pie dish.
For the potatoes:
Add potatoes to a large pot and cover with lightly salted water. Set over medium-high heat and bring to a boil. Cook until potatoes have softened and are fork-tender. Remove from heat and drain.
Mash potatoes then add butter, milk, salt, and pepper.
Spoon potato mixture over the top of the veggies in the pie dish, and smooth so that it is evenly spread.
Optional: using a butter knife or a long, thin spatula. press into potato surface every inch to create a beautiful, undulating presentation.
Bake pie for 20-25 minutes.
Allow to cool for five minutes.

Name: Dumplings with Peanut Sauce
Ingredients: 2 teaspoon miso paste, white or yellow
Directions: Remove from heat and let cool for 5 minutes. While the veggies are cooling, combine all ingredients for the Easy Peanut Sauce in a bowl and whisk together until smooth.

Transfer the veggie mixture from the skillet into a large food processor bowl. Pulse for 2-3 minutes for 10 seconds at a time until you reach the desired consistency. You want it to be mostly smooth but not a homogenous paste. (so still a tad chunky)

Place an eggless dumpling wrapper on a lightly floured surface. Spoon one heaping teaspoon into the center of the wrapper and carefully moisten the outer rim of the wrapper. Fold the Vegan Dumpling in half and press the edges together to seal them, making sure to remove all air from the center. Pinch the sealed edges in a visually pleasing fashion (or leave them flat) and cook them in a lightly oiled pan over medium heat for about 2 minutes on each side. Watch them as they tend to brown quickly.

Name: Falafel Onion Rings
Directions: Cut the white onions into 1cm thick slices & carefully push out the rings individual rings
Lay the rings out on a well oiled baking tray
Put all the falafel ingredients in a food processor & whizz them up into a paste
Tightly stuff each onion ring with falafel paste & then put them in the freezer until they're frozen solid (we froze ours overnight)
Put the plain flour & soy milk into a mixing bowl & mix it together until there's no lumps
Take the rings out of the the freezer
Dip the batter-covered rings in panko breadcrumbs (make sure they're well covered - that's how you get a nice crispy crust)
Put the onion rings in very hot oil & fry them until they're golden brown & crispy
Put the onion rings on some kitchen paper to soak up any excess oil

Name: Taco Cups (works well)
Ingredients: Vegan sour cream (Tofutti brand is good)
Directions: Cook the taco ingredients like you normally would
Cut the tortillas into quarters and put them into a muffin tin. Alternatively you can cut them into wide strips and put two strips criss-cross in each muffin tin spot
Load the taco ingredients into each one and then fold the top over
Bake in the oven until brown
Top with yummy stuff and salsa

Name: Falafel Waffles with Truffle Dill Mayo
Ingredients: 3/4 cup chickpea liquid (aquafaba), reserved from can
1/2 cup mini heirloom cherry tomatoes, quartered
Directions: Set a strainer or colander over a large bowl.  Pour the can of chickpeas into the strainer and allow the liquid (aquafaba) to drain into the bowl.  Measure out 3/4 cup aquafaba from the bowl for the batter.
To make the batter, pulse the aquafaba, rice flour, and 1/4 cup chickpeas in a blender or food processor until well mixed, 1-2 minutes.

Add the remaining chickpeas, 1/2 cup Just Mayo Truffle, 4 tablespoons tahini, dried dill, pinch of cayenne, garlic, 5 tablespoons lemon juice, 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon black pepper. Puree to form a smooth, thick batter.

To make Truffle Dill Mayo, whisk together the 1 cup Just Mayo Truffle, fresh dill, 2 tablespoons tahini, 11/2 tablespoons lemon juice, cumin, harissa, and salt. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.

Heat waffle maker to medium high. When the waffle maker comes to temperature, lightly spray waffle maker with cooking spray. Ladle 1/2 cup batter into waffle iron and cook until crispy, about 5 minutes.
Top each falafel waffles with 1-2 teaspoons of Truffle Dill Mayo, a handful of cherry tomatoes and cucumber slices.
Serve immediately.

Name: Falafel Hot Dogs
Directions: Blend ingredients
Scoop out and shape into hot dog shape on cookie sheet with parchment paper
Bake for 30 minutes at 400
Pair with sauteed onion, hot dog bun, condiments, pickles, etc.

Name: Carrot Fries (Recommended)
Directions: Cut carrots into fries and combine in a large bowl with olive oil, parsley, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Place on baking sheet lined with parchment paper in a single layer. Bake for 20-25 minutes, flipping halfway.
Prepare dip while fries are baking. Combine all dip ingredients in a small bowl and set aside in the refrigerator until ready to use.

Name: Spicy Masala Veggie Burgers (they stick together!)
Directions: In a food processor, grind the oats until they are a grainy powder. Add the veggies, and spices. Blend.
Shape the mixture into patties, and fry, grill, bake, or freeze them for later!

Name: Deviled Potato Bites
Ingredients: water- 2 Tbsp. (add more as needed for a creamier texture)
Directions: In a food processor, combine all remaining ingredients and blend thoroughly. Add more water as needed until the mixture is smooth and creamy.
Spoon mixture into a piping bag, and fill the potato cups.
Sprinkle with paprika or seasoning salt and chives.

Name: Broccoli Cheese Casserole
Ingredients: 1 large baking potato, about 1 lb., peeled and diced
1/2 cup chopped carrots, 1 large or 2 small
12 oz. button mushrooms, cleaned, stemmed and coarsely chopped
1/2 cup short or medium grain brown rice
1 large broccoli crown, broken into small florets (about 4 cups)
1 tablespoon lemon juice, plus more to taste
2-3 tsp. white miso paste, optional, but highly recommended
about 2 cups unflavored soy or almond milk
Directions: Place potato and carrots into a medium saucepan and cover with water. Bring to a boil. Lower heat and allow to cook at a low boil until tender, about 15 to 20 minutes. Remove from heat and drain into a colander. Transfer to a food processor and blend until completely smooth, stopping to scrape down sides of bowl as needed.

Add broth and rice to pot. Stir to incorporate. Raise heat and bring to a simmer. Cover and allow to simmer until rice is fully cooked, about 45 minutes. There should be some liquid remaining in the pot when rice is finished cooking.

Uncover pot and stir in potato mixture, broccoli, nutritional yeast, lemon juice and miso, if using. Thin with about 2 cups of milk, using a bit less if mixture seems too thin, more if it seems too thick. Stir and bring to a low simmer. Cook just until broccoli is tender and bright green, about 3 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.

Name: Lasagna
Ingredients: spices: oregano, basil, nutritional yeast, salt, pepper, paprika
Directions: Prepare and cut all the vegetables as instructed.
In the meantime, prepare the cashew bechamel and almond parmesan cheeze (as instructed in recipe). For the cashew bechamel sauce, add all the ingredients into the blender and mix until smooth.
Finish with a layer of tomato sauce and sprinkle the almond parmesan cheeze on top.
Cook in the oven for about 30 minutes

Name: Potstickers
Ingredients: 1/2 cup green onions, very thinly sliced
1 teaspoon black sesame seeds, toasted (plus additional for garnish)

Name: Simple Potato Curry
Ingredients: Some broccoli and other veggies of your choosing
Directions: Add 1 tablespoon coconut oil to large skillet on medium heat. Add minced garlic.
Once garlic is fragrant, add diced onion and cook until starting to turn translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add coconut milk, diced tomatoes, and spices. Stir to combine.
Bring to a low simmer and add potatoes.
Cover and let simmer on low/medium until potatoes are softened, 10-15 minutes.
Add frozen peas, stir, and let sit for 5 minutes.
Stir again and serve. Store leftover in airtight container for up to 1 week.

Name: Falafel Sandwich (Recommended)
Ingredients: 1/4 yellow onion, cut into 3 or 4 chunks
4 cloves garlic, divided (Leave 2 cloves whole and mince 2 cloves)
1 head green leaf or red leaf lettuce, ? coarsely shredded
Harissa or other hot sauce, optional
Directions: To a food processor, add chickpeas, yellow onion, flour, parsley, whole garlic, baking powder, cumin, coriander and salt and pulse to a grainy paste, scraping down bowl as necessary.
With lightly moistened hands, shape paste into 12 golf ball-size rounds, arranging on a cookie sheet. Cook falafel for like 15 minutes or until you can pick them up without them falling apart.

Coat a very large nonstick skillet with cooking spray and heat on medium-low. Working in batches if necessary to avoid crowding the skillet, add balls and use a spatula to flatten to about 1/2 inch thick. Cook until browned on bottom, 4 to 5 minutes. Flip and brown other side, 4 to 5 minutes.
Meanwhile, in a small bowl, whisk together tahini, 1/4 cup water, lemon juice, remaining minced garlic and paprika.

Cut about 1 inch off top of each pita, forming a pocket. Add 2 falafel to each pita and divide lettuce, tomato, cucumber, pickle, red onion and tahini sauce among pitas. Drizzle each with harissa (if using).

Name: Mo's Peanut Noodles
Ingredients: Also good: snap peas, hot peppers, bell peppers, green onion, ginger
Directions: Combine peanut butter, soy sauce, and a little bit of brown sugar. Add to pasta mix.
Put crushed peanuts and green onion on top if you're feeling fancy. You could also try adding sriracha though I've never done that.

Name: Uncle Jose's Potato Tacos
Ingredients: Make mashed potatoes (boil potatoes, mash them up, add butter and garlic and salt. If you don't have a potato masher or mixer make sure you boil them all the way or it's gunna be really hard to mash them up with a fork)
Put the mashed potatoes in the tortillas
Put oil (not olive oil) on a pan and put the potato tacos in the oil
Fry them until they're what you want
Add hot sauce, chopped tomatoes, and lettuce

Name: Mini Mediterranean Tarts (Good for when having people over, like for Shabbat. Simple to make)
Ingredients: 1. Lay the sheet of puff pastry onto a baking tray and cut into six squares. Then score a border onto the inside of the squares.
2. In a bowl, mix the tomato puree, oil, vinegar, salt and pepper to make a sauce. Then spread onto the inner of each square.
3. Put a few of each topping onto each of the squares.
4. Brush the puff pastry borders with soy milk
5. Cook for 15-20 minutes at 180? (356?), or until they begin to look golden brown
6. Serve, they're great hot or cold

Name: Crunch Wrap (like Taco Bell)
Directions: Cook the meatless crumbles in a pan on the stove
Mix together the butter, milk, cheeses, and nooch in a pot on the stove until melted and combined
Fry the small tortillas
Lay out the bigger tortilla and put the cheese and the meat on it, then place one of the smaller fried tortillas and put the sour cream, lettuce, chopped tomatoes, and more cheddar cheese on it.
Fold it up into like a pentagon and fry it.
Serve with hot sauce.

Name: Burrito Bites
Ingredients: Can also add corn, TVP or meatless crumbles, other veggies, or anything else. If you leave out the cheese, I'd really recommend adding in something else.
In a large pan, warm the oil and cook off the shallots until translucent, then add the garlic and salt and cook for a few more minutes

Add the red pepper and cook until slightly softer, then add the fajita mix and hot sauce and stir in well. Next, mix in the black beans and then the cooked rice. Add the coriander, stir well and take off the heat.
Take out of the oven and serve as nibbles or party food with guacamole and hot sauce!

Name: Spicy, Creamy Cannelloni
Directions: Add sauteed vegetables to blender, blend everything
Put the filling in cannelloni tubes
Put in pan, coat with olive oil
Top with tomato sauce and red pepper flakes
Cover and bake at 350 for 30 minutes
Top with daiya cheese and put back in for 10 minutes

Name: Cannelloni but with green stuff instead of red
Ingredients: 1.5 cups cashews (soaked in hot water for at least 20 minutes - actually not necessary if you're in a rush)
3.5 cups premade marinara sauce (really good quality - roughly 2 cups per jar)
1/2 small block dairy free white cheese (grated)
Directions: Put all the Ricotta Cheese ingredients in a blender and whizz them up into a thick cream (it should be the consistency of garlic and herb cheese)
Heat the olive oil in a small saucepan, fry the shallots and garlic until they're nicely cooked
Throw the basil and the spinach into the frying pan and cook everything together until the spinach is well wilted (about 2 minutes)
Put the contents of that pan into the food processor & pulse it in to the 'cheese' (make sure it's only MIXED not blended together - it should be cream with green flecks, not light green)
Put the 'cheese' into a piping bag and pipe it into the tubes of cannelloni pasta so they're well packed
Grease a lasagne dish and place the packed tubes of pasta neatly into it
Pour the tomato sauce over the cannelloni
Sprinkle on the grated cheese
Cover with tin foil, put the dish in the oven and bake for 35 minutes at 180?

Name: Super easy, fast Mac N Cheese. (Recommended)
Ingredients: Veggies if you want some with the pasta
Directions: Cook the pasta and blend all of the other ingredients together in a blender.

Name: Spaghetti Squash Pad Thai (pretty good)
Ingredients: 2 T agave (I used 1 T maple syrup)
1 T sriracha (I used 1 T chili garlic sauce)
Directions: Cook the spaghetti squash
Combine sauce ingredients and stir
Chop up the veggies and put them in a bowl. Take a fork and scoop out the cooked spaghetti squash and add it to the veggies. Add the sauce
Stir and put back into the empty squash shells if you want it to look cool

Notes: I found it to be a bit too watery, maybe don't add the water in the sauce or try to squeeze out some of the water that's in the squash after it's cooked. I would also recommend not adding the cilantro or green onion and putting the pad thai back in the oven for 15-20 minutes once everything is mixed in. Then add the cilantro and green onion.

Name: Marinated Tofu with Grain Salad for packed lunches (Recommended but lots of work)
Ingredients: 1 small butternut squash (cut into 1 inch pieces)
2 red red onion (cut into 1 inch pieces)
For the white bean, spelt & pea salad
Directions: Put the butternut squash on a baking tray and put it in the oven for 10 minutes at 400F.

Take the butternut squash out of the oven, put all the rest of the Roast Vegetable ingredients on the tray and mix them round with a wooden spoon, ensuring everything is well covered in flavour. Put the tray back in the oven for a further 20-60 minutes.
Put all the White Bean, Spelt and Pea Salad ingredients in a mixing bowl and fold them all together so everything is well mixed. Put the bowl to one side.
Put all the Salad Dressing & Marinade ingredients a food processor and whizz them together to form a liquid and pour half of the liquid into a wide, shallow bowl.
Cut the tofu steak into 4 equal slices and lay them down in the shallow bowl with the Salad Dressing & Marinade liquid in it. Turn the tofu steaks around in the liquid so they're well covered.
Put a griddle pan on the stove, get it quite hot and griddle the steaks so nice griddle lines appear on either side of the steaks. If you have any marinade leftover, pour it over the steaks.
Take the steaks off the griddle pan and set to one side.
Put all the hummus ingredients into a blender and whizz them up into a nice thick creamy hummus.
Take the roast vegetables out of the oven, pour over the sun dried tomatoes and mix them together and put the tray to one side.

Transfer equal amounts of the White Bean, Spelt and Pea Salad into 4 lunch boxes. Add equal amounts of the Roast Vegetables to the lunch boxes. Add equal amounts of the Hummus to the lunch boxes. Place one Tofu Steak to each lunch box. Add equal amounts of the Fresh Salad to the lunch box. Drizzle the remaining Salad Dressing & Marinade over the salad. Lock up your boxes, pop them in the fridge and don't forget to take them to work!

Name: Sweet Potato & Black Bean Enchiladas (Recommended)
Ingredients: 2 cups sweet potato, peeled and chopped small
1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
2.5 cups enchilada sauce (recipe in sauces section)
Directions: Preheat oven to 350F. Lightly grease a large rectangular baking dish.

Place the sweet potato in a medium saucepan and add enough water to cover. Bring the water to a boil, then reduce the heat to medium-high and simmer for 5 to 7 minutes, or until fork tender. Drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic and saute for about 5 minutes, until the onion is translucent. Season with salt and pepper.
Add the bell pepper, cooked sweet potato, black beans, and spinach. Raise the heat to medium-high and cook for a few minutes more, or until the spinach is wilted.
Remove the skillet from the heat and stir in 1/4 cup of the enchilada sauce, the lime juice, chili powder, cumin, and salt.

Spread 1 cup of the enchilada sauce evenly over the bottom of the prepared baking dish. Scoop 3/4 cup of the sweet potato filling onto each tortilla. Roll up the tortillas and place them seam side down in the baking dish. Spread the remaining enchilada sauce over the tortillas. If you have leftover filling, spoon it on top of the tortillas as well.
Bake the enchiladas, uncovered, for 20-25 minutes, until the sauce is a deep red color and the enchiladas are heated through.
Meanwhile, make the avocado-cilantro sauce.

Name: Sweet Potato and Peanut Stew (Recommended)
Ingredients: 1 medium red onion, peeled and diced
1 medium sweet potato, peeled and diced
1 large yellow bell pepper, seeded and diced
1 jalapeno, seeded and diced very finely
1/2 cup dried black beans, soaked overnight and cooked until tender
Directions: Heat the olive oil in a large soup pot. Add the curry paste and cinnamon. Stir for a minute so that the olive oil gets infused with spice. Add the onion, garlic, sweet potato, bell pepper, and jalapeno. Stir and cook the veggies for 5-7 minutes, until softened.
Add the beans and broth. Melt the peanut butter by mixing it with 1/2 cup boiling water. Add to the mix. Add the red pepper flakes and cilantro.
Bring the soup to a boil, then cover and simmer. Cook until veggies are tender, about 25 minutes.
Stir in the lime juice and brown sugar. Season with salt and black pepper.

Name: Spicy Black Bean Taquitos
Ingredients: Guac Sauce (see recipe in Toppings, Sauces, Sides)
Sour Cream (buy or see recipe in Toppings, Sauces, Sides)
2 cups cooked black beans or 1 can (19 oz - Canadian recipe!) rinsed and drained
1/2 cup diced red bell pepper (about 1/2 pepper)
3 t vegetable oil, plus 1/2 cup for frying
Directions: Process the onion halves, green onions, garlic, cumin, and chili powder in a food processor until very finely minced. Add the beans, jalapeno, corn, and bell pepper, and run the food processor a few times just to get everything very finely chopped, but don't process so much that the mixture becomes smooth.

Heat a large cast-iron skillet or heavy-bottomed pan over medium heat with 1 t of the vegetable oil. Add the mixture from the food processor and cook for 3-4 minutes, stirring occasionally, until soft and fragrant.
Pour the mixture into a large bowl. Add the cheese and stir to combine well.

Wipe out the skillet and coat it with 1 t of the vegetable oil heated over medium-low heat. Place 2-3 tortillas in the pan to warm up, flipping once or twice. This step may be unnecessary if you're using flour tortillas or have very fresh corn tortillas. I always find they're a little dry, and this will help with rolling the taquitos. Add the remaining 1 t vegetable oil to the pan after warming a few tortillas, if necessary. As you remove the warmed tortillas from the pan, start rolling them up. Place about 2 T of filling on one-third of a tortilla and shape into a log, rolling tightly and tucking one end under. Place the filled tortillas seam side down on baking sheets.
Once all the tortillas are warmed, leave the pan over the heat and add the 1/2 cup vegetable oil for frying.

Place the taquitos seam side down in the hot frying oil. They should sizzle immediately or else the oil isn't hot enough. Fry in batches for 3-4 minutes, flipping the taquitos halfway through. Lower the heat if necessary. Remove the fried taquitos to paper towels to absorb excess oil.
Serve with guac sauce, sour cream, and nacho cheese if you want.

Name: Southwest Chop Salad
Ingredients: 1 cup Coconut Bacon (see Toppings, Sauces, Sides - except it's not there yet cuz I'm lazy, so look it up lol)
1 cup finely chopped red onion (about 1 onion)
2 cups fresh or frozen and thawed corn kernels
2 cups cooked black beans, or 1 can (19 oz) black beans, rinsed and drained
1 large avocado, pitted, peeled, and diced
Directions: Assemble each salad with 2 cups of the chopped romaine, 1/4 cup red onion, and 1/2 cup each of the corn, beans, and tomatoes, plus 1/4 the avocado
Top with bacon and ranch dressing.

Name: Bean & Cheese Enchiladas Verdes
Ingredients: 1/2 cup raw cashews, soaked in hot water for 20 minutes
1 cup frozen corn, thawed and drained
1 cup cooked navy beans or 1 can (15 oz) navy beans, rinsed and drained
1 jalapeno chile, thinly sliced and seeded
Directions: To make the verde sauce, drain and rinse the cashews. Add to a high-powered blender along with the salsa verde, lime juice, and cilantro. Blend on high until very smooth. Set aside.
Preheat the oven to 375F. Lightly oil a rectangular baking dish about 12 by 18 inches with 1 t of vegetable oil

To prepare the enchiladas, heat a skillet over medium heat with 1 t of the vegetable oil and saute the onion and garlic for 2 minutes until just softened. Stir in the chipotle chile powder, salt, and pepper and cook for another minute. Add the corn and spinach and cook for about 2 minutes until the corn is cooked and the spinach is soft and wilted but still bright green. Stir in the beans and 1 cup mozzarella shreds and cook for another 2 minutes. Remove the filling from the pan to a dish and set aside.

Wipe out the pan and set over medium-low heat. Coat the pan with another T vegetable oil and heat the tortillas in small batches for 1 to 2 minutes, flipping as needed. Add the remaining T of vegetable oil if necessary for the next batches to get the tortillas softened and lightly coated in oil.
Pour a small amount of the verde sauce into the bottom of the oiled baking dish, spreading it out to coat the bottom.
Place about a scant 1/4 cup filling on each tortilla, roll tightly, and arrange seam side down in the dish. Make 2 rows of filled tortillas.

Pour the remaining verde sauce over the enchiladas and top with the remaining 1/2 cup mozzarella shreds and the jalapeno slices. Bake for 15 minutes until the cheese has melted and the edges of the tortillas are just turning golden brown.
Top with diced avocado, green onion, and cilantro. Serve immediately.

Name: Fajita Fiesta Bowls
Ingredients: 1 cup thinly sliced red bell pepper
1 cup thinly sliced green bell pepper
2 cups frozen corn, thawed and drained
Sour cream (see recipe in Toppings, Sauces, Sides, or buy)
Directions: To make the salsa, combine the tomato, onion, cilantro, and lime juice in a bowl. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

To make the lime rice, combine the rice, water, garlic, and salt in a pot, cover, and bring to a boil. Stir, cover again, lower the heat to a simmer, and cook for 10 to 15 minutes. While the rice is still warm, stir in the lime juice and cilantro. Set aside and keep covered. Adjust the water and cooking time for your particular brand of rice.

To make the fajita saute, in a skillet over medium-high heat, saute the bell peppers, onion, and portobellos with the vegetable oil for 3 minutes until the peppers and onions are just softened and the mushrooms are releasing moisture. Add the chipotle chile powder, salt, and pepper and continue cooking for 3-4 minutes until most of the liquid has evaporated or until cooked to your liking.
Make the guacamole right before assembling bowls. Halve and pit the avocados. Scoop the avocado flesh into a bowl and mash with the lime juice, salt, and pepper to taste.

Name: Seitan
Ingredients: 6 cups low sodium vegetable broth or water
Directions: Stir the vital wheat gluten and chickpea flour together in a medium bowl.
Add the water and stir to form a soft dough.
Transfer the dough to a work surface and knead it for 5 minutes.
Allow the dough to rest for 5 minutes.
While the dough rests, stir all of the broth ingredients for your choice of broth together in a large pot.
Place the pot over high heat and bring the mixture to a boil. Lower the heat to a low simmer.
Cut the dough into at least 4 large pieces, or if you prefer, smaller strips or chunks.
Add the dough to the broth. It expands as it cooks so cut the pieces smaller than you want them to end up.
Allow the broth to simmer for 1 hour, uncovered, watching closely to ensure it stays at a low simmer (don't allow it to rapidly boil).
Remove the pot from heat and allow it to cool a bit.
When the seitan is cool enough to handle, you can cut it into smaller pieces if you like. Use it in a recipe immediately, or store it in the broth. Refrigerate for up to 5 days, or freeze.

Name: Chicken Salad
Ingredients: 1 cup cooked or canned chickpeas, drained, rinsed and lightly mashed
8 ounces seitan (about 1/2 batch if using homemade - recipe above), finely diced
I would tear pieces apart with your hands rather than cutting them with a knife because it gives it a better texture. This is a lot of work, however, and your hands will be sore after.
1/2 cup slivered or sliced roasted almonds
cup vegan mayo, more or less depending on taste
Directions: Place the chickpeas into a medium bowl and roughly mash them with a fork or potato masher.
Add the remaining ingredients and stir until fully mixed.
Taste-test and adjust any seasonings to your liking.
Chill or serve immediately.

Name: Scott's Soup (Scotch Broth)
Ingredients: 1 cup soup mix (red lentils, pearl barley, split peas etc)
Heaped tbsp of Jen's veggie broth powder (see Toppings, Sauces, and Sides)
Approximately 1.2 litres of water, but enough to cover all of the veg by an inch or so.
Directions: Cube all of the root vegetables and saute with the onion and leek in olive oil for 5 mins.
Add the soup mix, broth powder and the veggie stock cube.
Add the water, bring to a boil and then reduce to a simmer for about an hour until all the veg is soft and the barley is cooked through.
Ta da.

Name: Elvia's Chipotle Salsa (Recommended)
Ingredients: Some chipotle peppers from a can
Directions: Broil the tomatoes, onion, and garlic whole (unpeeled - just as they came) in the oven until they start to get burnt
Take them out and peel them. Careful, they will be really hot
Add them to the blender with some chipotle peppers. Start with very few peppers and add more to taste (careful, they're spicy)

Name: Mushroom Gravy (Good for poutine and perogies)
Ingredients: 1/2 pound mushrooms, sliced or diced however you want
2 cups vegetable stock (if making for perogies, add way less)
1 teaspoon soy sauce (or use Tamari Soy Sauce for Gluten Free)
fresh cracked black pepper, to taste
kosher or sea salt, to taste
Directions: Make the cornstarch slurry: In a small bowl, add cornstarch and 1 tablespoon of water. Stir together well and break up all the clumps. Set aside.
Heat a medium saucepan on medium-high heat. Melt butter in pan and then stir in mushrooms.
Cook mushrooms until soft then slowly add vegetable stock, soy sauce and black pepper.

Bring gravy to a gentle simmer and cook for about 3 minutes or until mushrooms are tender. Add the cornstarch mixture and stir well so that no clumps form. Cook until the gravy is thick and remove from heat. Add additional salt to taste.

Name: Jen's Veggie Broth Powder
Directions: Place all, except parsley, in a blender in the listed order. Blend until powdered together. Add parsley and pulse to chop. Store in an airtight container indefinitely in the cupboard.
To make veggie broth, add 1 T powder to every quart of water.
Note: If you don't have an ingredient or don't like one, just omit.

Name: Gwen's Amazing Salsa
Ingredients: Two small jalapenos, or other hot peppers like pablanos, seeds removed for milder salsa
Directions: Broil the tomatillos on high and keep an eye on them and move them around on the tray so they roast evenly. You can also roast the peppers with them to take some heat out of them.
Chop the onion and the cilantro
Throw everything into a food processor with the salt and lime juice. Mix until the right consistency.
Cool and enjoy.

Name: Mo & Scott's Easy Cheese Spread
Ingredients: 1/2 T apple cider vinegar or some other vinegar
Optional: fresh herbs like parsley, cilantro, basil, dill, chives, green onion, thyme (or dried if necessary); nooch; garlic powder; onion powder; literally anything you want to try
Directions: Soak cashews in hot water for a while (longer the better, min 20 minutes)
Blend everything together
Add in fresh herbs after blended
Stays good for a while in fridge

Name: Quick Pickle Onions (Recommended)
Ingredients: 1 large red onion, sliced in half and halves sliced thin
1/4 cup fresh lime juice or lemon juice (from 2 limes or lemons)
Directions: Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Place the onions in a strainer set in the sink and pour the boiling water over the onions. After a few seconds, rinse under cold water.
Stir the lime juice, vinegar, salt, and sugar together in a large bowl, then add the onions. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before using (can be refrigerated for up to six weeks).

Name: William's Chex Mix (Recommended)
Directions: Preheat oven to 250
Pour chex, nuts, and pretzels into a very large bowl
Melt the butter and add the spices to the butter
Pour mixture over the chex, nuts, and pretzels
Spread it out on a cookie sheet and bake for 45 minutes, stirring every 15 minutes

Name: Taco Seasoning
Ingredients: 3 teaspoons of Pepper (I used white pepper instead of black)
Optional: 3/4 teaspoon Red Pepper Flakes depending on how spicy you want it

Name: Avocado-Cilantro Sauce
Directions: Put all ingredients in a food processor until smooth.  Good on enchiladas; burritos; stir-fry (after it's cooked); wraps and sandwiches

Name: Enchilada Sauce
Directions: In a medium saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat.
Stir in the flour until a thick paste forms. Stir in the chili powder, garlic powder, cumin, onion powder, and cayenne until combined. Cook for a couple of minutes until fragrant.

Stir in the tomato paste, followed by the broth. Whisk until smooth and combined. Bring to a low boil over high heat (covered, if necessary) and then reduce the heat to medium to maintain a simmer. Stir in the salt and simmer for about 5 minutes until thickened.

Name: Thai Peanut Sauce
Directions: Put all ingredients in food processor until smooth.
Simplify by not including the sesame oil or chili garlic sauce. I eat with fried tofu. Also good on salads.

Name: Mexican Tahini Dip
Directions: Blend all ingredients in a high speed blender or whisk in a bowl until smooth.

Name: Basil Cashew Cheeze Sauce
Ingredients: 1/4 cup vegetable broth or water (or more as needed)
1/4 cup fresh lemon juice 1/2 cup nutritional yeast (gives the cheese flavor)
3/4-1 tsp kosher salt (or to taste) + freshly ground black pepper
1 cup raw cashews, soaked in water for 30 mins or overnight OR cashew meal from TJs OR almond meal
Directions: Drain and rinse the soaked cashews. Add all ingredients (in the order listed) to a high-powered blender and blend until smooth.
Good as a sauce for lasagna; on sandwiches, wraps and pasta.

Name: Chipotle Sauce
Directions: Mix all ingredients together in a small dish or in a high speed blender. Serve.

Name: Chipotle Sauce 2.0 (Recommended)
Ingredients: 1/4 cup fresh water or more as needed
Combine all ingredients in blender. The smaller your blender the smoother it will be. And the more you soak the cashews. I added more cumin, lime juice, and chipotle pepper.

Name: Basic Hummus
Ingredients: 1 15 ounce can chickpeas drained (1 3/4 cups homemade)
Directions: To a food processor or blender, add the chickpeas, tahini, lemon juice, garlic, and salt and pepper. Pulse until well blended. Drizzle in olive oil until desired consistency is reached (hummus will firm up a little after refrigeration). Store in the refrigerator in an airtight container.
Vary in an infinite number of ways...Some add-ins or subs:
adobe chilies (from a can)
black instead of garbanzo beans
sun-dried tomatoes
olives
